00026 class Statistics {
00027  private:
00028   Listint *allStatistics;      
00029   Time totalTicks;         
00030   Time idleTicks;           
00031                           
00032  public:
00033   Statistics();            // initialyses everything to zero
00034   ~Statistics();           // de-allocate the list
00035   ProcessStat *NewProcStat(char *name); /* create a new ProcessStat, link it to allStatistics 
00036                                 and return a pointer on it. It is called by the 
00037                                 method which create a new process */        
00038 
00039   void Print();            /* prints collected statistics, including 
00040                                process statistics
00041                            */
00042   void incrTotalTicks (Time val) {totalTicks+=val;}
00043   void setTotalTicks(Time val) {totalTicks=val;}
00044   Time getTotalTicks(void) {return totalTicks;}
00045   void incrIdleTicks (Time val) {idleTicks +=val;}
00046 };

00095   void incrICacheMiss(void) {ICacheMiss++;}

00105 // Constants used to reflect the relative time an operation would
00106 // take in a real system, expressed in processor cycles
00107 #define USER_TICK       1   
00108 #define SYSTEM_TICK     1   
00109 #define TLB_TICKS       1   
00110 #define MEMORY_TICKS   10   
00111 
00112 // Speed of the peripherals (expressed in nanoseconds)
00113 // The speeds of the peripherals are not linked to those of the CPU
00114 #define ROTATION_TIME  1000  
00115 #define SEEK_TIME      1000  
00116 #define CONSOLE_TIME   1000  
00117 #define CHECK_TIME     1000  
00118 #define SEND_TIME      1000  
00119 #define TIMER_TIME    10000
